required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Kinetics Study of the Urinary Cortisol Elimination in Athletic Subjects After Knee Intra-articular Infiltration With Triamcinolone Acetonide
clinical_study.official_title: Kinetics Study of the Urinary Cortisol Elimination in Athletic Subjects After Knee Intra-articular Infiltration With Triamcinolone Acetonide

brief_summary.textblock:
Joint and abarticular glucocorticoid therapy infiltration are common in sports traumatology, but it can cause problems under global anti-doping legislation. Particularly, if the possibility of systemic passage is proven, the glucocorticoïdes urinary kinetics elimination should be clarified.
The study purpose is to determine the time to normalize glucocorticoids value in urinary sampling following intra-articular ultrasound-guided infiltration of Triamcinolone acetonide

primary_outcome.measure: Determination of time to change and normalize the value of glucocorticoids in urinary sampling following intra-articular ultrasound-guided infiltration of Triamcinolone acetonide
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline glucocorticoids urinary value at 10 months
primary_outcome.description: For subjects with a glucocorticoids urinary value below the 30 ng/ml threshold at J0 (before injection), identification of the date following the intra-articular ultrasound-guided injection which will correspond in the standards of the World Agency (under 30 ng/ml)

arm_group.description: athletic subjects who may need intra-articular knee infiltration

intervention.intervention_name: knee intra-articular infiltration with Triamcinolone acetonide
intervention.description: knee intra-articular intra-articular ultrasound-guided infiltration of Triamcinolone acetonide

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sports practice at least 4h / week
- no comorbidities against indicating intra-articular knee infiltration
- Person with an intra-articular pathology of the knee requiring intra-articular infiltration of triamcinolone acetonide
Exclusion Criteria:
- Person with gluccocorticoid allergy or gluccocorticoid contraindication
- pregnant woman or Woman of childbearing potential without effective contraception
- taking glucocorticoids less than 3 months orally, intrarectally or intramuscularly.

facility.name: Centre Hospitalier Régional Universitaire de Nancy.
